title: The Great Gatsby
description: A classic novel set in the Jazz Age, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream through the eyes of narrator Nick Carraway.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee's masterpiece addressing racial injustice in the Deep South, told through the perspective of young Scout Finch.
George Orwell's dystopian vision of a totalitarian society, where Big Brother surveils every aspect of citizens' lives.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen's timeless romance exploring themes of social class, marriage, and personal growth in Regency-era England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger's iconic novel following disaffected teenager Holden Caulfield as he navigates adolescence and societal expectations.

title: The Hobbit
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's beloved tale of hobbit Bilbo Baggins' unexpected adventure to reclaim treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.

title: The Lord of the Rings
description: Tolkien's epic trilogy chronicling the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron, set in the world of Middle-earth.

title: Moby-Dick
description: Herman Melville's literary masterpiece exploring themes of obsession, revenge, and the human condition through the journey of Captain Ahab.

title: The Great Expectations
description: Charles Dickens' novel follows the journey of orphan Pip, exploring themes of ambition, identity, and social class in Victorian England.

title: Jane Eyre
description: Charlotte BrontÃ«'s classic novel follows the life of governess Jane Eyre, exploring themes of love, independence, and morality.

title: The Alchemist
description: Paulo Coelho's allegorical novel follows Santiago, a shepherd boy, on his journey to fulfill his personal legend and discover the meaning of life.

title: The Hunger Games
description: Suzanne Collins' dystopian trilogy follows protagonist Katniss Everdeen as she navigates a brutal government-sponsored competition and leads a rebellion against tyranny.
